com.bazaarvoice
Class BazaarParams

java.lang.Object
  com.bazaarvoice.BazaarParams
Direct Known Subclasses:
DisplayParams, SubmissionMediaParams, SubmissionParams
public abstract class BazaarParams
extends java.lang.Object

The base class for adding parameters to a BazaarRequest. This class should not be used to add parameters. Instead, use one of the derived classes: DisplayParams, SubmissionParams, SubmissionMediaParams.

Created on 7/9/12. Copyright (c) 2012 BazaarVoice. All rights reserved.

Author:
Bazaarvoice Engineering

Parameters:

date - the date used to encode the user
userId - the user ID

setEncryptUser

public void setEncryptUser(java.lang.String userAuthKey,
                           java.lang.String userId)
Encrypt the user based on the authentication key, user ID and today's date.

Parameters:
userAuthKey - the user authentication key
userId - the user ID

getEncryptedUser

public java.lang.String getEncryptedUser()
Gets the previously set user ID string.

Returns:

addURLParameter

public static java.lang.String addURLParameter(java.lang.String url,
                                               java.lang.String name,
                                               java.lang.String value)
Add a parameter to the current url.

Usage:
This is called internally by subclasses of BazaarParams and by BazaarRequest. This may be able to be used to add additional parameters, but is not recommended. For additional fields, see SubmissionParams.addAdditionalField().

Parameters:
url - the current url with or without parameters
name - the name of the parameter to add
value - the value
Returns:
the url with the parameter added

addURLParameter

public static java.lang.String addURLParameter(java.lang.String url,
                                               java.lang.String name,
                                               java.lang.Boolean value)
Add a boolean parameter to the current url as long as the value is not null.

Usage:
This is called internally by subclasses of BazaarParams and by BazaarRequest. This may be able to be used to add additional parameters, but is not recommended. For additional fields, see SubmissionParams.addAdditionalField().

Parameters:

the url with the parameter added

This is called internally by subclasses of BazaarParams and by BazaarRequest. This may be able to be used to add additional parameters, but is not recommended. For additional fields, see SubmissionParams.addAdditionalField().

addURLParameter

public static java.lang.String addURLParameter(java.lang.String url,
                                               java.lang.String name,
                                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> map)
Add a map of parameters to the current url in the form "name_key1=value1&name_key2=value2".

Usage:
This is called internally by subclasses of BazaarParams and by BazaarRequest. This may be able to be used to add additional parameters, but is not recommended. For additional fields, see SubmissionParams.addAdditionalField().

Parameters:
url - the current url with or without parameters
name - the name of the parameter to add
map - the map of values to add
Returns:
the url with the parameter added

addURLParamsFromList

public static java.lang.String addURLParamsFromList(java.lang.String url,
                                                    java.lang.String name,
                                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> values)
Add a list parameters to the url from a list in the form "name=value1,value2,value3".

Usage:
This is called internally by subclasses of BazaarParams and by BazaarRequest. This may be able to be used to add additional parameters, but is not recommended. For additional fields, see SubmissionParams.addAdditionalField().

Parameters:
url - the current url with or without parameters
name - the name of the parameter to add
values - the list of values that will be separated by commas
Returns:
the new url

addNthURLParamsFromList

public static java.lang.String addNthURLParamsFromList(java.lang.String url,
                                                       java.lang.String name,
                                                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> values)
Add a list parameters to the url from a list in the form "name_1=value1&name_2=value2&name_3=value3".

Parameters:
